tweets.text: #30DayMapChallenge Day 22 Movement. The retreat of the Holderness coast, data from various sources, including @EnvAgency, @OrdnanceSurvey. Lost land, villages and rates of retreat in m/y. @tjukanov #gis #qgis https://t.co/feGmpxBedx

The dank waters of the Olympic Park wetlands, where one of London's largest sewers overflows.
The smell from the Mulberry Court Combined Sewer hangs in the air.
The bed of the 'river' is grey. 
Thames Water must tell us when it pollutes, in real-time and comply with the law. https://t.co/9snoarcOVe
Elastic bands clogging this drain. How many entered the watercourse? @stwater @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWestMidlands @KeepBritainTidy https://t.co/RGbTzZiWkM

Wetlands Bickershaw Project, converting an urban culvert into a naturalised stream, with all the wildlife and habitat benefits, also protecting 100 homes downstream. @WiganCouncil @Lancswildlife  @EnvAgency https://t.co/krD62KVsYm

Our fisheries enforcement officers have been out on a regular patrol at Coton Hall Lake, Lea Marston, #Warwickshire after reports of illegal fishing. Pleased to report all anglers checked were legal.
Buy a #fishing license: https://t.co/h54cBUjB6C https://t.co/LHU0aboNZY

tweets.text: After multiple habitat improvement measures such as rewilding in the Ennerdale valley, and the removal of migration barriers, the Arctic Charr restoration scheme is now in the ‘monitoring’ phase. Numbers appear to be healthy again this year! https://t.co/mnzsSq77Pv
